e We made use of different symbols while making this sketch.

e To convert a sketch into a map, you need to show the directions, and include

an index, a title and a scale.

e Moving objects are not included on a map. For example, people walking,

moving vehicles, etc.

e A winding road in an area is shown to take exactly the same turns on a map.
That is how roads, rivers and railway lines are always shown on the map.

The art of mapmaking has now advanced

greatly. Our ancestors also used to make maps.
They used animal skins, bones, cowries and clay
or stone tablets to make maps. Approximately
5000 years ago, there was a civilization called
Mesopotamia. A clay tablet of those days showing
some parts of Mesopotamia is shown alongside. Take a look.
